meanings.definition: A member of the working class.
meanings.sent1: The proletaries worked hard in the factories to earn a living.
meanings.sent2: The city was bustling with proletaries going to their jobs.
meanings.sent3: The proletaries organized a fun picnic for all the workers.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the protagonist was a proletaries fighting for fair wages.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tired proletaries walking home stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: The lowest class of citizens in ancient Rome, who had no property.
meanings.sent1: During ancient Rome, the proletaries struggled to make ends meet.
meanings.sent2: The senate ignored the pleas of the proletaries for better living conditions.
meanings.sent3: The wealthy Roman citizens threw a party and invited the proletaries for fun.
meanings.sent4: The story depicted the harsh life of a proletaries in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent5: The image of the poor proletaries begging for food was heartbreaking.
